text:
Do we have any illustrators involved? It would really help create localized assets needed for campaigns. Like icons/clip-arts/stock images/emojis with local dresses and skin color. Most illustrations we are using seem to be of foreigners because we are getting the assets from stock image or free providers.

<@UV8B0679P> Can Efrem suggest somebody?

elements.text: Do we have any illustrators involved? It would really help create localized assets needed for campaigns. Like icons/clip-arts/stock images/emojis with local dresses and skin color. Most illustrations we are using seem to be of foreigners because we are getting the assets from stock image or free providers.
Can Efrem suggest somebody?

text: <@UVALAR52P> welcome! I like the idea of creating localized assets!:clap::skin-tone-4: Our  #awareness-content team is in charge of on creating illustrators and we would like you to join these talented workforce. Reach me out for any questions. Thanks

text: <@U010BJ06WTE> <@U0108RVKK3P> <@U010A7SS5PW> <@UV6JJDDKL> <@U010B22ESES> <@UVD6SD63D> <@UVALWD1MG> <@U010CLFURT8>
<@UVALAR52P> Hi, this is Luladey. Nice to meet you. Does Efrem have any specialties? So far we have been working on Posters and social media posts. Feel free to let me know if you want to know more.

elements.text: Hi, this is Luladey. Nice to meet you. Does Efrem have any specialties? So far we have been working on Posters and social media posts. Feel free to let me know if you want to know more.

text:
<@U010BJ06WTE> Selam Luladey. Ephrem Girma (Mike's friend and biz partner) is a graphic designer and connected with the creative community here in DC. I am hoping he could refer us to a digital illustrator that is willing to volunteer and help create the digital assets.

Assets needed are (ie blue taxis, people with traditional cloth, buildings - churches and mosques with local architecture, brown people - nurses, doctors, laborers, ...). This is a lot of work so we need more than one illustrator if possible and even adapt preexisting icon libraries for our use. That way our awareness products will have harmony. Anyway I will reach out to him offline.

I would also like to see the posters that have been developed and see how I can help. Sorry came in late so I am still trying to catch up

elements.text:
Selam Luladey. Ephrem Girma (Mike's friend and biz partner) is a graphic designer and connected with the creative community here in DC. I am hoping he could refer us to a digital illustrator that is willing to volunteer and help create the digital assets.

Assets needed are (ie blue taxis, people with traditional cloth, buildings - churches and mosques with local architecture, brown people - nurses, doctors, laborers, ...). This is a lot of work so we need more than one illustrator if possible and even adapt preexisting icon libraries for our use. That way our awareness products will have harmony. Anyway I will reach out to him offline.

I would also like to see the posters that have been developed and see how I can help. Sorry came in late so I am still trying to catch up

text:
Hi <!here>
Is there anyone working on just pure Audio content such as simple PSA's and Corona related skits?
This can be used to be shared on Radio, IVR platform and any other medium that does not require access to social media or internet.

text: <@U010VSAKD1S> - I don't think there has been a campaign for audio/video from this channel yet. We have been told that if the content we make is approved, we could share it on ETV and radio. We need someone with experience to work on a campaign. Do you have experience/background in that area?

elements.text: - I don't think there has been a campaign for audio/video from this channel yet. We have been told that if the content we make is approved, we could share it on ETV and radio. We need someone with experience to work on a campaign. Do you have experience/background in that area?

text: Hey <@U010EJ90XSM> and <@U010S2X77U5> - The children's educational video I saw on FB is excellent. I was very impressed that it also incorporated sign language. Do you guys also work on adult audio/video content?

and

text: Hey Keneni. As an organization we a really focused on children, but we have been creating adult targeted content for Covid19 the last couple weeks. (By we I really mean <@U010S2X77U5> and the amazing WKW team which I’m not heavily involved with anymore.)

elements.text: Hey Keneni. As an organization we a really focused on children, but we have been creating adult targeted content for Covid19 the last couple weeks. (By we I really mean
and the amazing WKW team which I’m not heavily involved with anymore.)

text: I have some indirect experience with campaign content. I mostly work on optimizing content for being shared over the phone as pre-recorded audio messages. What exactly is needed?

text: We (Ethio-American Doctors Group) are putting together a series of online webinars to share experiences in intensive care of the sick and infection control. We have held our first Zoom conf with medical schools/hospitals in Black Lion, Hawassa, Gonder, and we are waiting for connection with Jimma, Mekelle and Barhir Dar. We hope to reach 250 healthworkers. Also, we will pair critical care physicians here in US with colleagues in Ethiopia through WhatsApp for direct consultation. We have also started a gofundme effort and raised 1/3 of $100k (<https://slack-redir.net/link?url=https%3A%2F%2Ft.co%2FwqScbrEwxv%3Famp%3D1|gf.me/u/xsgra9>) goal to help health workers in Ethiopia. Finally, one of our members is a former Google Scientist who moved to Ethiopia with his family about a year or so ago. He teaches at Addis Ababa Univ. He will be great help on this effort. I have invited him to Slack: Solomon Gizaw, PhD <mailto:solomong@aau.edu.et|solomong@aau.edu.et>. I know this is information dump but wanted to share in one message. Mel <tel:2022715046|(202-271-5046>; <mailto:mnegussie@ethioamericandoctors.com|mnegussie@ethioamericandoctors.com>). I will post elsewhere as well. Thanks.

elements.text: We (Ethio-American Doctors Group) are putting together a series of online webinars to share experiences in intensive care of the sick and infection control. We have held our first Zoom conf with medical schools/hospitals in Black Lion, Hawassa, Gonder, and we are waiting for connection with Jimma, Mekelle and Barhir Dar. We hope to reach 250 healthworkers. Also, we will pair critical care physicians here in US with colleagues in Ethiopia through WhatsApp for direct consultation. We have also started a gofundme effort and raised 1/3 of $100k (
gf.me/u/xsgra9

) goal to help health workers in Ethiopia. Finally, one of our members is a former Google Scientist who moved to Ethiopia with his family about a year or so ago. He teaches at Addis Ababa Univ. He will be great help on this effort. I have invited him to Slack: Solomon Gizaw, PhD
solomong@aau.edu.et
. I know this is information dump but wanted to share in one message. Mel
mnegussie@ethioamericandoctors.com
). I will post elsewhere as well. Thanks.

text:
WOW... .0.0001%??? This video needs to be everywhere. It is remarkably well put together and needs to be shown to the public and decision makers. It drives the point of needing the social distancing that is so hard to sell to Ethiopia. Well done <@U010EJ90XSM> and <@U010S2X77U5> and everyone on the team that worked on creating this.

Has this specific video been broadcast on TV?

text: Mel, as you know, there is also a National Call to Duty from the PM for retired healthcare workers. Do you know how they are going to be upskilled/retooled? Maybe include them in your training plans? The same would go for Med Students who may be asked to step up and work on their own. I would think group mentorship and experience sharing would be relevant in both clusters. Just putting this on the radar.

elements.text: Mel, as you know, there is also a National Call to Duty from the PM for retired healthcare workers. Do you know how they are going to be upskilled/retooled? Maybe include them in your training plans? The same would go for Med Students who may be asked to step up and work on their own. I would think group mentorship and experience sharing would be relevant in both clusters. Just putting this on the radar.
